image.altText: two men and a women in business suits share a joke around a coffee table in an office

items.synopsis: Both Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Treasurer Jim Chalmers were careful not to offer any criticism of Philip Lowe.  But the decision not to keep him on speaks for itself, writes David Speers.

title.children: Like an episode of Veep, Albanese and Chalmers walked a fine line

image.altText: Michele Bullock

items.synopsis: With a review calling for major change at Australia's central bank, was an internal promotion the best choice for governor? We asked three experts.

title.children: 'Doesn't seem a natural choice': Why Michele Bullock's appointment as RBA governor surprised some economists

image.altText: Vladimir Putin wearing a suit, looking off camera

items.synopsis: The Russian president said he offered mercenaries the opportunity to keep fighting if Prighozin was replaced with another commander, but the Wagner chief declined.

title.children: Putin says Wagner Group 'does not exist', while Biden jokes that Prigozhin should be careful what he eats

image.altText: Caleb Ewan purses his lips

items.synopsis: Australian sprinter Caleb Ewan left the Tour de France without a stage win after pulling out before the Grand Colombier climb on stage 13.

title.children: Australian sprinter Caleb Ewan out of Tour de France

image.altText: A car driving past a sign that reads: "Caution! Extreme heat danger".

items.synopsis: As the US experiences a major heatwave and extreme temperatures are expected to keep rising, tourists are not shying away from the famous desert sites of the country's national parks.

title.children: The hottest spot on Earth draws in visitors amid a major heat wave in the United States

items.synopsis: The amateur snake catcher said it was "one hell of a fight" capturing the python without getting bitten.

title.children: Florida man filmed wrestling and capturing world-record-length Burmese python

image.altText: A large white space rocket leave a trail of flames and smoke as it flies into clouds and up into the sky.

items.synopsis: India aims to become just the fourth nation, along with the United States, the former Soviet Union and China, to land spacecraft on the Moon as it tests technology it hopes to use in future interplanetary missions.

title.children: 'A safe and soft landing on lunar surface': India's latest mission to Moon blasts off

image.altText: Kevin Spacey outside london court

items.synopsis: The Oscar winner is facing court after being accused of sexually assaulting four different men in the United Kingdom.

title.children: Kevin Spacey says sexual assault allegations against him were made up for money

image.altText: A father holds a baby, as he stands at a window.

items.synopsis: Australian men are reporting high-level loneliness. These experts are trying to understand why, and what can be done to fix the problem.

title.children: Which age group of men are the loneliest? This survey had surprising results

image.altText: A young-looking Thai man in a blue suit stands amid a crowd of similarly dressed people with orange ties.

items.synopsis: Only 13 senators backed Move Forward's Pita Limjaroenrat, with the rest voting against him or abstaining, which the party said indicated some were acting under duress.

title.children: Thailand's Move Forward party moves to curb Senate power after old guard blocks party's PM candidate

image.altText: Energy drink

items.synopsis: The artificial sweetener aspartame has been listed as a possible carcinogenic hazard to humans.  But what does that mean for your diet soft drink habit? Here's how to digest the findings, writes Evangeline Mantzioris.

title.children: Should you stop drinking diet soft drinks after the new cancer advice?

image.altText: Australia's Mary Fowler throws her arms out and smiles after a goal against France.

items.synopsis: Mary Fowler scores the match-winner as the Matildas beat France 1-0 in their final hit-out less than a week before their first World Cup clash with Ireland, who cannot finish their last pre-tournament friendly.

title.children: Matildas beat France while first World Cup opponent cuts short 'overly physical' pre-tournament friendly

image.altText: Jake Melksham flexes some muscle and yells in delight after kicking a goal

items.synopsis: A Jake Melksham goal with under a minute on the clock completes a remarkable comeback for Melbourne, as the Demons kick the game's last four goals to beat Brisbane by a point.

title.children: Epic Demons comeback snatches victory from Lions in dying seconds

image.altText: Deputy Ukrainian Defence Minister Hanna Maliar poses for a picture in front of army tanks.

items.synopsis: The weapons arrived a week after the United States said it would send them as part of an $US800 million security package.

title.children: Ukraine receives cluster munitions, pledges limited use as Russia threatens to use similar banned weaponry

image.altText: Between thin trees, you view industrial buildings on an overcast day with the building in the middle pictured in bright pink.

items.synopsis: The teacher, who had also previously poisoned her husband with the same toxin she used on the children, was first sentenced to nine months in jail but that was upgraded to the death penalty.

title.children: China executes kindergarten teacher who poisoned 25 of her students, killing one

image.altText: a group of people in parliament chambers

items.synopsis: The bill bans medical workers from "performing medical interventions designed to change the sex of a person," including prescribing hormone therapy to patients.

title.children: Russian parliament takes step toward banning gender reassignment surgery

image.altText: A smiling man in a suit and tie

items.synopsis: Former special forces soldier Heston Russell is suing the ABC along with two journalists over a story published on television, radio and online on November 19, 2021.

title.children: ABC allowed to reinstate defence as former soldier's defamation case headed for trial

image.altText: Margot Robbie and Ryan Gosling

items.synopsis: The last time Hollywood's actors and writers went on strike at the same time, the biggest stars were fighting for residual pay cheques. Decades later, streaming giants and artificial intelligence are at the heart of the debate.

title.children: 'It's very disturbing to me': Why Hollywood CEOs are outraged actors and writers have walked off the job

image.altText: A scene from the second season of Netflix's drama Stranger Things

items.synopsis: Actors in Hollywood are going on strike, bringing many shows grinding to a halt and impacting some Australian productions. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: Production on Stranger Things has shut down due to the SAG-AFTRA strike. Will your favourite TV show be impacted?

image.altText: Referee Peter Gough signals 10 minutes in the sin bin for Newcastle Knights player Jack Hetherington.

items.synopsis: The Newcastle Knights take their points tally to 100 in the past two weeks, with a 34-18 victory over the Wests Tigers backing up their 66-0 win against Canterbury last week.

title.children: Knights thump Tigers as NRL bad boy gets sent for seventh time in 60 games

image.altText: Smiling person, short brown hair, hands on hip, wears Australian Army uniform dress. Sunshine, blurred house, greenery behind.

items.synopsis: When Captain Jesse Noble realised they were gender diverse, it felt like being " hit in the face with a truck". A Christian marriage, their faith, and their career in the army were all at stake.

title.children: How Jesse's dress is overturning the army's gender diversity policy

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair smiles at the camera while sitting in a resturant.

items.synopsis: Dale Vella is sentenced to 24 years in prison for the murder of her husband, Mark Vella, who she shot in the eye as he slept in their Murrumbateman home in August 2021.

title.children: NSW woman sentenced to 24 years in jail for murdering husband as he slept

image.altText: A young man smiles while holding a a bow at a sideshow alley stall.

items.synopsis: The family of stabbing victim Nicholas Henry say they have nightmares of his brutal end as he tried to flee three young men who "hunted" him down.

title.children: Family's nightmares over slain teen's 'unmerciful' stabbing death

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a dark suit holds a press conference in front of a lectern. Aboriginal and Australian flags are behind him.

items.synopsis: The pesticides authority CEO and board chair resign, after a review triggered by allegations one of the agency's workers urinated on his colleagues.

title.children: Following claims a public servant urinated on colleagues, pesticides authority CEO and board chair resign

image.altText: A surfer treading water near a surfboard with a sea otter on it.

items.synopsis: Sea otter 841 is a five-year-old female who has a history of aggression towards surfers. She'll probably end up in a zoo, but she may be euthanised.

title.children: Officials trying to capture 'very bold' sea otter that's been wrestling surfboards off surfers

image.altText: Colette Harmsen with supporters outside Hobart court.

items.synopsis: For the first time in over 10 years an environmental activist is jailed in Tasmania, with the protester telling supporters outside court "if that makes me a dangerous criminal … we are going to need bigger prisons".

title.children: Jailed mining protester 'deserves Order of Australia' says Bob Brown

image.altText: A bright yellow Lotus drives around a corner, with mountainous scenery in the background.

items.synopsis: Targa Australia says it has been forced to "suspend all future motorsport-based events" in the wake of sweeping rule changes enforced by Motorsport Australia following a horror run of deaths — with one veteran competitor saying it is a "very sad day".

title.children: Targa suspends 'all future events' due to sweeping rule changes made after race deaths

image.altText: A woman and a man wearing black shirts have a neutral expression, standing on brown soil surrounded by vines.

items.synopsis: Riverland wine grape growers are experiencing higher crop losses this year due to disease, possibly worsened by neglected vineyards nearby.

title.children: Grape growers hit by worst disease pressures in decades raise concerns about unmanaged vineyards

image.altText: A metalic Toyota symbol on a White Toyota Hi-Lux with the defective DPF.

items.synopsis: Toyota has announced a technological breakthrough in batteries, but questions have been raised over the company's dubious EV track record.

title.children: Why some EV drivers are sceptical of Toyota's battery breakthrough

image.altText: Dr McCarthy is holding a camera taking a scan of a model ship

items.synopsis: Marine archaeologists create a haunting digital reconstruction of the Batavia using Dutch models and photos of the wreck site off the coast of Western Australia.

title.children: The story of the Batavia is a bloody chapter in maritime history. Now, its wreck has new life
